p: Ruminants produce CH 4 through enteric fermentation, and options to mitigate this source are somewhat limited ( Beauchemin et al., 2011). Other sources of emissions from livestock production are manure management and changed feed rations. To reduce GHG emissions from manure management options include (i) changes to manure storage, e.g. decreased storage time, manure storage cover with straw, or mechanical intermittent aeration during manure storage ( Hristov et al., 2013), (ii) manure acidification ( Ndegwa et al., 2011, Petersen et al., 2012), (iii) feeding of livestock with nitrate supplements ( Van Zijderveld et al., 2011) and (iv) stacking of poultry litter ( Gerber et al., 2013). To reduce GHG emissions from feed, all mitigation measures previously discussed for crops could be considered, as well as using the residues from crop production as feed.
